Articles.Content:
Looking out the window of the Dres 1 during takeoff.

Edited April 19, 2017 by Shadow Wolf56
In a mothership docked in a space station on Eve Orbit, waiting for the arrival of the brand new Eve01 space plane, which was designed especially to land and return from Eve.
Stuck on Gilly.

On the Mün estsblishing the first permanent base of the Mün at the moment, but the spacecraft for the first mission to Duna has just started to be built, and he will be lainching at that very shortly after returning to Kerbin.

At home....

I did strand a different kerbal on gilly that could have been jeb though...
Currently in a bunker awaiting a missile strike. Two other Kerbals died in same bunker last night, hoping the improvements can save him.
Finally home after few months on lonely EVA on the Mun.
stuck on eve... and with no rescue plan for 5 real months and counting <
Sitting in the KSP laughing his ass off at those newbies stuck on 3 year long research missions around the moon
He's on his way back to the KSC after an extended vacation at Tulum Station...
On Dres. Sort of...

I use Jebediah as a test pilot for every single mission. If he survives, then the craft's design is good and is ready to be used by the other Kerbals. If something goes wrong, then I don't have to worry as he always manages to get back to the KSC. He recently piloted a space shuttle back to the KSC without the left wing and with an engine flameout, and the parachutes had burnt up in re-entry for some reason. But I'm not going to go into that.          

Edited May 2, 2017 by KerbalManiac

My jeb is... dead. After finishing some contract on LKO, I performed reentry, but I forget that I've turned on the kerbal G limit. Jeb was knocked unconscious during reentry, causing me to lose control over the command pod and unable to deploy parachute. Jeb was finally awake... at the altitude of 500m... with the parachute deployed too late to slow the pod before it crashes
Currently stranded around Duna very high orbit that does not get Ike encounters. Along with Bill, Bob and a few dozen other Kerbals.

Heck, you never know. Right now he's... *SwooooooSSSHHHHHHHHHH!!!!*

DARNIT JEB!!! STOP.... BUZZING.... THE.... FREAKING..... TOWEEEERRRRR!!!!!!!

My Jeb is stranded on Vall waiting for a rescue ship; Bill abandoned him in search of a nice place to set up a base.

Edit: I landed my Vall base near Jeb, Jeb is now back home!

Edited May 2, 2017 by Vall9X4562

My Jeb? He's off intercepting and shooting down innocent Passenger Jets containing multiple kerbals.

 

Edited May 2, 2017 by TheDARKOMETER
Forgot an image, and accidentally duplicated an image ^^

My Jebediah is currently stranded orbitting Ike.

He's there with a rather large team, including Valentina.

 

Mission control made a slight miscalculation.

The refueling shuttle that worked very well during test runs on Minmus failed to leave Ike's gravity.

It appears that Ike is about 10 times as massive as Minmus, who would have thought?
I put him in a space station where he's less likely to be accidentally ker(b)sploded. Then again, I never was the best at docking...
Jeb and all the rest of my useless pilots are stuffed away in a makeshift dormitory overlooking the the launch facilities from a distance.
Jeb is standing by to launch on dresxpress.

He made it to Ike and is part of the two-Kerbal crew of a mining base, using the base's probe control capabilities to make sure that the unmanned fuel transport ships don't lose control in the middle of a landing.

He docked a propulsion Unit to my Station in a Minmus-Orbit and flew it along with it's crew of two female Scientists to an orbit around the Mun. Bob is on his way to the station with a Mun-Lander. He's gonna pick up Jeb, they will land on the Mun and return to Kerbin after a quick stop at the Station.

Jeb literally is MIA. He was flying an early career (hard) game propeller plane when the game client froze. Reloading the game returned the plane, but not Jeb.

He is out there. Somewhere...

Edited May 3, 2017 by Spraki
